page.description: Add an easy way to filter data to any app with List Column Actions.

discussion.p: Column Actions allow you apply filters to the data in the List. When the List is rendered, the list columns will appear as shown in the image below.

description.p: Note that each column in the list has an icon. You can turn the icon off for specific columns if you don't want all columns to show the icon.

section.title: Adding Column Actions to a List

description.p: To turn on *[ui:Column Actions]* on for a *[ui:Columnar Layout]*, check the *[ui:Has column actions]* property.

If you have turned *[ui:Column Actions]* on, you may still want to not show the icon for a particular column. To turn off the icon for a particular column, go to the *[ui:Layout]* tab and check the *[ui:Hide column actions]* button.

section.title: Using Column Actions to Filter Data

description.p: When the user clicks on an icon for a particular column, a dropdown is shown. The dropdown shows all of the unique values in the column. For example to find all records with value of *[ui:Henry]* in the *[ui:Firstname]* column, check *[ui:Henry]* in the list and then click the *[ui:Filter]* button.
To find all of the records where *[ui:Firstname]* is not equal to *[ui:Henry]*, click the *[ui:Not Equals]* icon before clicking the *[ui:Filter]* button.
You can also click the *[ui:Contains]* and *[ui:Does Not Contain]* icon before clicking the *[ui:Filter]* button.
To clear the filter, click the *[ui:Clear]* button.
You can type into the input box to filter the list of values shown in the dropdown. In the image below, the dropdown list shows all values that contain the value "am".
If you have selected some, but not all, of the values in the list, the icon for the *[ui:<Select All>]* item indicates that a partial selection has been made.
If all items in the dropdown have been selected, the icon for the *[ui:<Select All>]* item indicates that all items have been checked.
Once a filter has been applied, the icon in the column header is changed to indicate that the data in that column has been filtered.
If you specify a filter for multiple columns the criteria for each column are ANDed.
Certain customization options are available for Column Actions. These include:

item.name: Position for column action icon
item.description: In the case where you have configured a List for right-to-left display you would want the icon for column actions to appear to the left of the column label

item.name: Tooltip for icon buttons in the column actions dropdown
item.description: You can customize the text for the tooltips shown in the column actions dropdown. You can use language and text dictionary tags in the labels (.e.g. *[html:<a5:r>Equals</a5:r>]*)

figure.title: The icon can be placed on the left or right side of the column

When you turn on Column Actions for a columnar Layout in a List control, an filter icon is shown in the column header for each column in the List. The column actions provide a very powerful and convenient way for filtering the data in a List.
